subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Dunkirk, the favorite, beat a field of Triple Crown hopefuls in a $42,000 allowance feature at Gulfstream Park. A Kentucky-bred $3.7 million yearling purchase, Dunkirk was fifth going to the far turn but won the 1 1/8-mile race by four and three-quarter lengths. Seven of the 10 3-year-olds in the field are nominated for the Triple Crown. The trainer Todd Pletcher said Dunkirk’s next start would be in the Florida Derby at Gulfstream on March 28.
